title: Matt Hancock defends Priti Patel over bullying claim
description: The health secretary says Priti Patel is "courteous", despite claims from her ex-top civil servant.

title: Coventry stabbing: Teens arrested over 'house party' attack
description: Two teenagers are arrested on suspicion of murdering Ramani Morgan in Coventry.

title: Coronavirus: South Korea churches halt services as cases soar
description: Catholic churches are closed across the country, which is battling the worst outbreak outside China.

title: Coronavirus: 'Nothing ruled out' in government's virus battle tactics
description: Big events could be banned and schools closed in the "worst-case scenario", the health secretary says.

title: England beat West Indies to reach T20 World Cup semi-finals
description: England reach the Women's T20 World Cup semi-finals after Natalie Sciver hits 57 in a 46-run thrashing of West Indies in their final group game in Sydney.

title: A visual guide to the outbreak
description: Key maps and charts explaining how the Covid-19 virus has spread and how it is being dealt with.

title: 'One-handed and it stuck' - Mady Villiers holds 'screamer' to dismiss Shemaine Campbelle
description: England spinner Mady Villiers takes a "one-handed screamer" of a catch to have West Indies' Shemaine Campbelle caught and bowled.

title: Climate change: Warm winter ruins German ice wine harvest
description: Temperatures in Germany's wine-growing regions were not cold enough to produce the dessert wine.

title: Northern rail: Government takes over after chaos
description: The government takes over services from Sunday which were previously operated by Arriva Rail North.

title: Tyson Fury v Deontay Wilder III 'before Olympics, July', says promoter Bob Arum
description: Deontay Wilder will fight Britain's WBC heavyweight world champion Tyson Fury for a third time this summer, according to promoter Bob Arum.

title: Afghan conflict: President Ashraf Ghani rejects Taliban prisoner release
description: Ashraf Ghani says he has not pledged to free 5,000 militants, as stated in a key US-Taliban deal.

title: Storm Jorge: Flood-hit towns battle wettest February on record
description: Dozens of flood warnings remain in place as Storm Jorge brings high winds and yet more rain.

title: Women's T20 World Cup: West Indies' Shakera Selman takes a brilliant catch to dismiss England's Danni Wyatt
description: England lose their second wicket as West Indies' Shakera Selman takes a brilliant catch in Sydney at the Women's T20 World Cup.

title: Boy's tooth fairy money helps house Ilford's homeless
description: A £5m homeless centre opens in east London and it all began with a £5 donation from a 10-year-old boy.

title: ICYMI: Furry first steps and a hippo's pit stop
description: We've gone animal-tastic with some of the stories from around the world that you may have missed this week.

title: Britain's Watson wins Mexican Open for fourth WTA Tour title
description: Britain's Heather Watson wins the Mexican Open by beating Canada's Leylah Fernandez 6-4 6-7 (8-10) 6-1.

title: South Carolina primary: Joe Biden wins decisively
description: The former vice-president, whose campaign had faltered, claims a huge win in South Carolina's primary.

title: Coronavirus: US confirms first death, in Washington state
description: President Donald Trump says more cases are "likely" but urges people not to panic.

title: The Papers: 'Chaos' at Home Office, and No 10 baby on way
description: The row at the top of the Home Office and Boris Johnson's baby news lead many of Sunday's front pages.

title: Carrie Symonds: Who is Boris Johnson's fiancee?
description: Boris Johnson and his girlfriend, conservationist Ms Symonds, are engaged and expecting a child.

title: 'Ember months': War of words as Nigerian English recognised by OED
description: Not everyone is happy that the Oxford English Dictionary now includes several unique Nigerian words.

title: 6 Music Festival: 'When bands smash guitars it breaks my heart'
description: 6 Music Festival acts on the "chaotic" highs and lows of being a musician in 2020.

title: Running Stories: 'Running helped me deal with my dad’s suicide'
description: Katie's dad took his own life in 2017. Now, she is carrying on his legacy by keeping running.

title: Into the Wild: Why tourists are risking their lives to visit an old bus
description: Five more tourists were rescued trying to reach a bus made famous by Into the Wild. Why do they do it?

title: St David: Ten things about the Patron Saint of Wales
description: The patron saint of Wales was a teetotal vegetarian who was born in a storm.

title: Plastic pollution: Snowdon research is a 'wake-up call'
description: Scientists say the discovery near the top of Wales' highest mountain must prompt action.

title: Coronavirus: Italian economy takes a body blow
description: Could Italy's health crisis be the factor that tips the country into another recession?

title: One-armed potter: 'I just muddle my way through'
description: Gary Fulton lost the use of his right arm in a motorcycle accident that nearly killed him.

title: NHS gender clinic 'should have challenged me more' over transition
description: A woman is taking legal action against an NHS gender clinic which treated her as a teenager.

title: US election: Is this the best way to pick Trump's challenger?
description: The way Democrats pick a nominee takes months, costs a fortune and doesn't even lead to high turnout.
